You are the global administrator of a tenant.
An account is blocked due to suspicious user activities.
You need to investigate the user activities.
Where should you investigate activities? To answer, drag the appropriate portals to the correct activities. Each portal may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

choices.A: Run the following PowerShell cmdlets: New-AzureADPolicy | Set-AzureADPolicy
choices.C: From Azure Active Directory, modify external collaboration settings.
choices.B: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify external collaboration settings.
choices.D: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the Communicate with Skype users option.

questions.question_text:
A ExamTopics company has a Microsoft 365 subscription. The company implements a new security policy that has the following requirements:
✑ Guest users from specific domains must be allowed to collaborate by using Microsoft Teams.
✑ Guest users must be prevented from inviting other guests.
You need to recommend a solution to meet the security policy requirements.
What should you recommend?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
external sharing configuration
Disabling ADAL forces basic auth and will disable modern auth

Correct Answer: 
1. Event Viewer
2. Re-add the users work/school account
3. Delete content from the Ngc folder

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/troubleshoot/administration/disabling-adal-wam-not-recommended - Disabling ADAL or WAM authentication as a solution to fix sign-in or activation issues can have adverse effects in your environment and is not recommended.

https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/msteams/forum/all/microsoft-teams-error-80090016/a0889e12-f0d0-4f02-b229-277af5005843

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/answers/questions/41436/urgent-my-desktop-app-of-teams-showing-error-code.html

DRAG DROP -
You manage the Microsoft Teams environment for a tenant.
Users report authentication issues. In the Azure AD admin center, you view many sign in error codes.
You need to manually reset Seamless Single Sign-on (SSO).
Which five actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

choices.B: Confirm whether the domain is in the external access allowed list.
choices.D: Use the Microsoft Teams web app.
choices.C: Ask the administrator of the external domain to add your domain to their Allowed Domain list.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The answer is correct, you just need to add one specific person to the team (not entire domain). Enabling guest access and adding User2 to team is easiest and best option
External access – lets you find, call, and chat with users in other domains. Guest access – lets you add individuals to your teams, as guests, using their email address

Selected Answer: E
Federation is already in place so no need for the other options, just allow guest access in the required portals.
